discovered that other snakes faced with amphibian prey having TTX have adapted by
altering the sodium channels in a way similar to garter snakes. Recently we have
discovered that caddis fly larvae are resistant to TTX and feed on newt eggs. This will
require rethinking what we know” about snake-newt coevolution.”

title_original: Competição ou Facilitação? Forças estruturadoras de comunidades vegetais em estágio inicial de desenvolvimento
title_english: Competition or Facilitation? Forces structuring early stage plant communities
abstract_original:
O caráter manipulativo da Ecologia da Restauração abre perspectivas de
usar experimentos para gerar e testar novas hipóteses em Ecologia. As
interações entre as plantas desempenham um papel essencial na
estruturação e funcionamento das comunidades vegetais. Este projeto
pretende avaliar o papel da distribuição espacial e da disponibilidade de
recursos sobre espécies de grupos sucessionais diferentes, através do
monitoramento do plantio de espécies arbóreas em um projeto de
restauração de
abstract_english:
The manipulative nature of Restoration Ecology opens up prospects for
using experiments to generate and test new hypotheses in Ecology. The
interactions between plants play an essential role in structuring
structuring and functioning of plant communities. This project
intends to evaluate the role of spatial distribution and resource
on species of different successional groups, through the monitoring of
monitoring the planting of tree species in a
restoration project

title_original: Como aumentar as chances do seu artigo ser aceito em uma boa revista?
title_english: How to increase the chances of your article being accepted in a good journal?
abstract_original:
Qual é o público alvo do meu trabalho?’ Para qual revista devo
submeter meu manuscrito?’ O que eu devo escrever nessa tal de cover
letter?’ Eu devo sugerir o nome de potenciais revisores para o meu
trabalho?’ Essas e outras dúvidas sobre o processo de publicação são
comuns entre aqueles que estão começando a carreira acadêmica.
Nesta palestra, usarei minha experiência como revisor e editor de
revistas internacionais para responder as questões levantadas acima e
dar dicas que poderão aumentar as chances do seu manuscrito ser
aceito em um periódico de alto impacto.
abstract_english:
What is the target audience for my paper?
should I submit my manuscript to?' What should I write in this so-called cover
letter?' Should I suggest the name of potential reviewers for my paper?
These and other doubts about the publication process are common among those
common among those who are just beginning their academic careers.
In this talk, I will use my experience as a reviewer and editor of
international journals to answer the questions raised above and give tips that
and give tips that can increase the chances of your manuscript being accepted in a
accepted in a high-impact journal.

title_original: A bird of all trades is a bad one: relação entre dieta e diversificação em aves
title_english: A bird of all trades is a bad one: relationship between diet and diversification in birds
abstract_original: Interações biológicas desempenham um papel importante na diversificação de organismos. Algumas dessas interações estão intimamente ligadas (sejam elas antagonísticas ou mutualísticas) à dieta, o que torna essa característica muito importante para a diversificação. Estudos sobre interações entre espécies tradicionalmente focam em poucas espécies, mas recentemente tornou-se possível descrever grandes redes ecológicas. Uma abordagem de redes pode aumentar a compreensão dos papéis ecológicos desempenhados por diferentes espécies, mas a pouca ênfase em abordagens evolutivas em estudos de redes biológicas nos impedem de compreender completamente como essas redes são montadas. Usando a filogenia e dados de dieta disponíveis para todas as espécies de aves (aprox. 9965 espécies), e uma grande coleção de redes de frugivoria, pretende-se investigar as consequências evolutivas da dieta nas taxas de especiação e extinção, e o papel da especiação e extinção na construção de redes ecológicas. Nós usaremos abordagens de máxima verossimilhança e bayesiana para estimar as taxas de especiação e extinção associadas a diferentes guildas de dieta. Nesta oportunidade, serão apresentados os resultados obtidos até o momento sobre as taxas de diversificação associadas à cada dieta.
abstract_english: Biological interactions play an important role in the diversification of organisms. Some of these interactions are closely linked (whether antagonistic or mutualistic) to diet, which makes this feature very important for diversification. Studies on species interactions traditionally focus on a few species, but recently it has become possible to describe large ecological networks. A network approach can increase understanding of the ecological roles played by different species, but the lack of emphasis on evolutionary approaches in biological network studies prevents us from fully understanding how these networks are assembled. Using phylogeny and diet data available for all bird species (approx. 9965 species), and a large collection of frugivory networks, we aim to investigate the evolutionary consequences of diet on speciation and extinction rates, and the role of speciation and extinction in the construction of ecological networks. We will use maximum likelihood and Bayesian approaches to estimate speciation and extinction rates associated with different diet guilds. At this opportunity, the results obtained so far on the diversification rates associated with each diet will be presented.

title_original: Efeitos do uso da terra em assembléias de peixes das cabeceiras do Rio Xingu
title_english: Effects of land use on fish assemblages in the headwaters of the Xingu River
abstract_original:
A expansão da fronteira agrícola amazônica representa possivelmente a mais
extensa e profunda mudança no uso da terra do mundo contemporâneo. Na conversão de
florestas em pastagens e plantações de soja, a degradação de ambientes ripários e a
construção de barragens ameaçam a integridade dos ecossistemas aquáticos mais
diversos do planeta. Por meio deamostragens padronizadas em riachos
replicados, avaliamos os efeitos do uso da terra na estrutura e composição de
assembléias de peixes das cabeceiras do Rio Xingu, e testamos a hipótese de que o
aquecimento da água reduz o tamanho corporal dos peixes.
abstract_english:
The expansion of the Amazonian agricultural frontier represents possibly the most
extensive and profound land use change in the contemporary world. In the conversion of
In the conversion of forests to pasture and soybean plantations, the degradation of riparian
the integrity of the planet's most diverse aquatic ecosystems.
diverse aquatic ecosystems on the planet. Through standardized sampling in replicated streams
we assess the effects of land use on the structure and composition of fish assemblages in
structure and composition of fish assemblages in the headwaters of the Xingu River, and tested the hypothesis that
water warming reduces fish body size.

title_original: Recursos pesqueiros dos manguezais do estuário do Rio São Francisco (Nordeste do Brasil): análise sócio-ecológica
title_english: Fisheries resources of the mangroves of the São Francisco River estuary (Northeast Brazil): a social-ecological analysis
abstract_original:
Manguezais são sistemas sócio-ecológicos complexos que ocupam cerca de 60 a 75% de regiões costeiras
(sub)tropicais, onde são responsáveis pelo provimento de uma série de recursos pesqueiros que são fonte
de renda e subsistência para populações humanas tradicionais. No Nordeste do Brasil, o Estuário Rio São
Francisco (10o 30 27 S, 36o 2345 W) apresenta uma extensa área de florestas de manguezais (30 km2
),
as quais são tradicionalmente usadas para pesca por populações humanas de oito povoados costeiros que
apresentam baixos índices de desenvolvimento humano. Embora essa área faça parte de uma Unidade de
Conservação de Uso Sustentável (APA Litoral Norte), a pobreza, a diminuição dos recursos pesqueiros e o
desmatamento de manguezais para a construção de tanques de criação de camarão exótico
(carcinocultura) são fatores limitantes para o alcance da sustentabilidade. No presente estudo adotamos
uma abordagem sócio-ecológica para a caracterização do uso dos recursos pesqueiros dos manguezais
desse estuário, percepções das comunidades locais sobre mudanças que ocorreram na produção desses
recursos durante os últimos 13 anos e suas perspectivas para o desenvolvimento local. As informações
levantadas servirão como base para a implementação de medidas para uma gestão sustentável dos
recursos pesqueiros, desenvolvimento sustentável local e conservação dos manguezais.
abstract_english:
Mangroves are complex social-ecological systems occupying about 60-75% of (sub)tropical coastal regions, where they are responsible for providing a range of fishery resources that are a source of
(sub)tropical coastal regions, where they are responsible for providing a range of fishery resources that are a source of
source of income and subsistence for traditional human populations. In Northeastern Brazil, the São Francisco River Estuary
Francisco Estuary (10o 30 27 S, 36o 2345 W) presents an extensive area of mangrove forests (30 km2
),
which are traditionally used for fishing by human populations from eight coastal settlements that
villages that present low rates of human development. Although this area is part of a Sustainable
Conservation Unit (APA Litoral Norte), poverty, diminishing fishery resources, and the deforestation of mangroves
deforestation of the mangroves for the construction of exotic shrimp farms (carcinoculture) are factors
(carcinoculture) are limiting factors for achieving sustainability. In the present study we adopted
a social-ecological approach to characterize the use of mangrove fishery resources in the estuary
of this estuary, perceptions of local communities about changes that have occurred in the production of these
In the present study we adopted a social-ecological approach to characterize the use of mangrove fishery resources in this estuary, perceptions of local communities about changes that have occurred in the production of these resources during the last 13 years, and their perspectives for local development. The information
information gathered will serve as a basis for implementing measures for sustainable management of fisheries
fishery resources, local sustainable development and mangrove conservation.

title_original: Aquaculture and sustainability of coastal ecosystems
title_english: Aquaculture and sustainability of coastal ecosystems
abstract_original:
While promising a revolution in food production, salmon aquaculture can also
affect wild salmon populations via shared disease dynamics. In this talk I
investigate the dynamics of parasite populations that spill over to wild salmon
and then spill back to domesticated populations. Using a mixture of field
studies and mathematical models, I show how these parasites have had a
major impact on the dynamics of some wild salmon populations. I address
impacts at three levels: infection, mortality and population dynamics. I review
the recent history of these impacts and show how they have improved through
changes in management. This work is joint with Martin Krkosek and Stephanie
Peacock.
abstract_english:
While promising a revolution in food production, salmon aquaculture can also
affect wild salmon populations via shared disease dynamics. In this talk I
investigate the dynamics of parasite populations that spill over to wild salmon
and then spill back to domesticated populations. Using a mixture of field
studies and mathematical models, I show how these parasites have had a
major impact on the dynamics of some wild salmon populations. I address
impacts at three levels: infection, mortality and population dynamics. I review
the recent history of these impacts and show how they have improved through
changes in management. This work is joint with Martin Krkosek and Stephanie
Peacock.

title_original: Efeitos da exposição ao mercado sobre a dependência e diversidade de consumo dos produtos florestais não madeireiros: estudo em quatro sociedades amazônicas do Brasil e da Bolívia
title_english: Effects of market exposure on dependence and diversity of consumption of non-timber forest products: a study in four Amazonian societies in Brazil and Bolivia
abstract_original:
As sociedades autárquicas e semi-autárquicas fazem uso dos produtos florestais não
madeireiros (PFNM) para diversas formas de consumo (alimentação, construção,
ferramentas, cuidados pessoais, dentre outros). Quando essas sociedades aumentam a sua
participação no mercado, alterações podem ocorrer no uso desses recursos. Este estudo
buscou contribuir com as informações sobre efeitos no consumo de PFNM. Para isso, foi
testada a hipótese de que maior renda e maior tempo dedicado às atividades relacionadas
com o comércio de PFNM estão associados à diminuição do consumo de PFNM e também
a redução da riqueza e uniformidade das categorias de uso desses produtos coletados
pelas unidades domésticas para o próprio consumo. Por meio de survey e de técnicas de
observação sistemática direta (weigh day e alocação de tempo), foram coletados dados, de
156 unidades domésticas entre 1999 e 2005, pertencentes a quatro sociedades
amazônicas do Brasil e da Bolívia. As informações levantadas apontam para uma
necessidade de formulação de políticas públicas voltadas ao desenvolvimento de
populações florestais, que leve em conta o valor dos diversos tipos de uso dos PFNM.
abstract_english:
Autarchic and semi-autarchic societies make use of non-timber forest products (NTFPs) for
timber forest products (NTFPs) for various forms of consumption (food, construction
tools, personal care, among others). When these societies increase their
participation in the market, changes may occur in the use of these resources. This study
sought to contribute to information on effects on NTFP consumption. To this end, we tested
tested the hypothesis that higher income and more time dedicated to activities related to the
related activities are associated with decreased consumption of NTFPs and also with reduced wealth and
a reduction in the richness and uniformity of the categories of use of these products collected by
by households for their own consumption. By means of survey and
observation techniques (weigh day and time allocation), data were collected from 156 households between
156 households between 1999 and 2005, belonging to four Amazonian societies in Brazil and
Amazonian societies in Brazil and Bolivia. The information gathered points to a need for the formulation of
need to formulate public policies aimed at the development of forest populations
forest populations, that takes into account the value of the various types of use of NTFPs.

title_original: Abelhas de desenvolvimento
title_english: Developmental Bees
abstract_original:
A criação de abelhas nativas, também chamada de meliponicultura, gera renda a comunidades
rurais, reduz a necessidade de explorar outros recursos naturais e cria incentivos para proteger o
meio ambiente. Além disso, a meliponicultura contribui com a preservação das abelhas nativas e
dos serviços de polinização que elas fornecem, os quais são fundamentais para garantir a
produtividade de muitas culturas comerciais e manter a biodiversidade de plantas dos
ecossistemas naturais. No Brasil, a meliponicultura é ainda uma atividade essencialmente
informal, o conhecimento técnico é escasso e as práticas de manejo carecem de padronização.
Nesse trabalho, aproveitamos essa grande diversidade de práticas de manejo para identificar
quais delas maximizam a produção de mel e colônias e aumentam a renda gerada pela venda
desses produtos 1. Um questionário foi elaborado em parceria com pesquisadores e criadores
estabelecidos, logo validado em campo, e finalmente aplicado a mais de 250 criadores de 20
estados Brasileiros. O impacto de determinadas práticas de manejo sobre a produtividade e a
geração de renda foi avaliado utilizando um procedimento de seleção de modelos. Os resultados
destacam a importância de ensinar aos meliponicultores como inspecionar e alimentar suas
colônias, como multiplicá-las, como colher e preservar o mel, como controlar a infestação de
parasitas e como agregar valor ao rotular os recipientes de mel. Além disso, a experiência dos
meliponicultores e sua rede de criadores conhecidos tiveram uma influência importante sobre a
produtividade e a renda. Preservar as abelhas nativas é particularmente importante agora,
quando grandes populações de abelhas estão desaparecendo por causa de doenças, agrotóxicos
e a degradação dos seus ambientes naturais. A meliponicultura pode ajudar a conservar as
abelhas, manter os seus serviços de polinização e contribuir com o desenvolvimento de muitas
comunidades rurais. O nosso trabalho fornece indicações claras para aperfeiçoar a atividade e
ajudar a transformá-la numa poderosa ferramenta de esenvolvimento sustentável.”
abstract_english:
Native beekeeping, also called meliponiculture, generates income for rural communities
communities, reduces the need to exploit other natural resources, and creates incentives to protect the
environment. In addition, meliponiculture contributes to the preservation of native bees and the pollination
and the pollination services they provide, which are essential to ensure the productivity of
productivity of many commercial crops and maintain plant biodiversity in natural ecosystems.
natural ecosystems. In Brazil, meliponiculture is still an essentially informal
technical knowledge is scarce and management practices lack standardization.
In this work, we take advantage of this great diversity of management practices to identify which of them
which of them maximize honey and colony production and increase the income generated by the sale of these products 1.
A questionnaire was developed in partnership with researchers and established breeders
and farmers, then validated in the field, and finally applied to more than 250 farmers in 20 Brazilian
Brazilian states. The impact of certain management practices on productivity and income
income generation was evaluated using a model selection procedure. The results
the importance of teaching honey beekeepers how to inspect and feed their colonies, how to multiply
colonies, how to multiply them, how to harvest and preserve honey, how to control parasite infestation
and how to add value by labeling honey containers. In addition, the experience of
In addition, the experience of meliponiculturists and their network of known breeders had an important influence on productivity and income.
productivity and income. Preserving native bees is particularly important now
when large bee populations are disappearing due to diseases, pesticides, and the degradation of their natural
and the degradation of their natural environments. Meliponiculture can help conserve bees, maintain their
maintain their pollination services and contribute to the development of many rural communities.
rural communities. Our work provides clear indications for improving the activity and
help turn it into a powerful tool for sustainable development."

title_original: Macroecology of mutualistic plant-animal networks
title_english: Macroecology of mutualistic plant-animal networks
abstract_original:
The structure of species interaction networks is important for species
coexistence, community stability and exposure of species to extinctions.
Specialization, modularity and nestedness are often interpreted as
evolutionary ecological structures that may have relevance for community
persistence and resilience against perturbations, such as climate-change
and human impact. Therefore, both current ecological, historical and
evolutionary factors could therefore influence these network structures. I
am presenting a range of studies testing this using a macroecological
approach on mutualistic pollination and frugivore networks. These studies
show that ecological, historical and evolutionary signals are evident in
pollination networks, whereas large-scale spatial variation in frugivorous
networks predominantly seems determined by current ecological factors.”
abstract_english:
The structure of species interaction networks is important for species
coexistence, community stability and exposure of species to extinctions.
Specialization, modularity and nestedness are often interpreted as
evolutionary ecological structures that may have relevance for community
persistence and resilience against perturbations, such as climate-change
and human impact. Therefore, both current ecological, historical and
evolutionary factors could therefore influence these network structures. I
am presenting a range of studies testing this using a macroecological
approach on mutualistic pollination and frugivore networks. These studies
show that ecological, historical and evolutionary signals are evident in
pollination networks, whereas large-scale spatial variation in frugivorous
networks predominantly seems determined by current ecological factors.”

title_original: The interplay between society and culture among sperm whales
title_english: The interplay between society and culture among sperm whales
abstract_original:
Culture and society influence one another, especially when we primarily associate with and
learn from like-minded individuals. Social patterns and cultural behavior are closely tied
among sperm whales as well. Their society is organized into sympatric clans, defined by
distinctive communicative acoustic repertoires learned from their peers. In this talk, I will
present the behavior with computer simulations to explore the causes and consequences of
the cultural clans of sperm whales off the Galápagos Islands. The many months we have
spent following this elusive species in their remote environment have revealed striking
similarities with our own society. Our findings provide evidence that processes generating the
complex human cultures may also be at play in animal societies, a crucial step to evaluate
the contrasts and convergences between these two kinds of culture.”
abstract_english:
Culture and society influence one another, especially when we primarily associate with and
learn from like-minded individuals. Social patterns and cultural behavior are closely tied
among sperm whales as well. Their society is organized into sympatric clans, defined by
distinctive communicative acoustic repertoires learned from their peers. In this talk, I will
present the behavior with computer simulations to explore the causes and consequences of
the cultural clans of sperm whales off the Galápagos Islands. The many months we have
spent following this elusive species in their remote environment have revealed striking
similarities with our own society. Our findings provide evidence that processes generating the
complex human cultures may also be at play in animal societies, a crucial step to evaluate
the contrasts and convergences between these two kinds of culture.”

title_original: Bases biomecânicas da alimentação e o papel trófico de cifomedusas (Cnidaria, Scyphozoa) na costa sudeste do Brasil
title_english: Biomechanical basis of feeding and trophic role of cyphomedusae (Cnidaria, Scyphozoa) in the southeast coast of Brazil
abstract_original:
Em medusas de Scyphozoa, a pulsação da umbrela proporciona o impulso
locomotor e também atua na captura de presas. Durante as pulsações são
produzidos vórtices que escoam fluidos para os braços orais, os quais retêm
presas planctônicas através de um mecanismo aderente e filtrador. O objetivo
desta apresentação é demonstrar as bases biomecânicas da alimentação e o
papel trófico de cifomedusas da costa sudeste do Brasil. Será demonstrado
como esse mecanismo filtrador se desenvolve ao longo do crescimento das
medusas, através de métodos videográficos de alta frequência de captura de
imagens. A morfologia e a mecânica alimentar determinam os hábitos
alimentares e os papéis tróficos de cifomedusas. Serão discutidas as
implicações da sobreposição dos nichos tróficos entre medusas e peixes,
quantificados através da análise de isótopos estáveis (13C e 15N) em um
sistema estuarino na costa sudeste do Brasil”.
abstract_english:
In jellyfish of Scyphozoa, the pulsation of the umbrella provides the
locomotor drive and also acts in prey capture. During the pulsations
vortices are produced that drain fluids to the oral arms, which retain planktonic
planktonic prey through an adherent, filtering mechanism. The objective
of this presentation is to demonstrate the biomechanical basis of feeding and the
trophic role of cyphomedusae from the southeast coast of Brazil. It will be demonstrated
how this filtering mechanism develops throughout the growth of the jellyfish
through high-frequency videographic methods of image capture.
methods. The morphology and feeding mechanics determine the feeding
feeding habits and trophic roles of cyphomedusae. We will discuss the
implications of overlapping trophic niches between jellyfish and fish will be discussed,
quantified by stable isotope analysis (13C and 15N) in an estuarine system
estuarine system on the southeast coast of Brazil."

title_original: Es preciso manejar la recuperación de los ecosistemas después del fuego?
title_english: Is it necessary to manage the recovery of ecosystems after fire?
abstract_original:
Post-fire restoration is meant to mitigate or reverse negative fire impacts. Impacts
are related to fire regime and its interactions with ecosystem fire-resilience. In the
case of severe fire regimes, main ecological impacts affect nutrient budget, soil
erosion risk and the reduction of biodiversity. Planning post-fire restoration requires
the identification of the specific degradation processes triggered by fire, including
their time and spatial dimensions, and vulnerable ecosystems. Restoration should
address identified vulnerable areas, and mitigate soil erosion and runoff risk in the
short-term, and the recovery of nutrient cycling and keystone plant species in the
longer term. We present the approach developed for assessing post-fire restoration
in the Mediterranean basin based in the prediction of soil erosion risk and vegetation
vulnerability.”
abstract_english:
Post-fire restoration is meant to mitigate or reverse negative fire impacts. Impacts
are related to fire regime and its interactions with ecosystem fire-resilience. In the
case of severe fire regimes, main ecological impacts affect nutrient budget, soil
erosion risk and the reduction of biodiversity. Planning post-fire restoration requires
the identification of the specific degradation processes triggered by fire, including
their time and spatial dimensions, and vulnerable ecosystems. Restoration should
address identified vulnerable areas, and mitigate soil erosion and runoff risk in the
short-term, and the recovery of nutrient cycling and keystone plant species in the
longer term. We present the approach developed for assessing post-fire restoration
in the Mediterranean basin based in the prediction of soil erosion risk and vegetation
vulnerability.”

title_original: A abstinência sexual promove movimentos estratégicos em machos do besouro Leptinotarsa undecimlineata (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae)
title_english: Sexual abstinence promotes strategic movements in males of the beetle Leptinotarsa undecimlineata (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae)
abstract_original:
Em sistemas de acasalamento do tipo scramble competition, disputas entre machos são
raras ou ausentes e a expectativa teórica é que machos com alta mobilidade obtenham
mais cópulas. Leptinotarsa undecimlineata é uma espécie com sistema de acasalamento
do tipo scramble competition cujos indivíduos copulam somente sobre a planta hospedeira.
Nessa espécie, movimento e sucesso reprodutivo estão relacionados de forma peculiar: os
machos que mais se movem, são os que menos copulam. Uma hipótese que explicaria
esse padrão é que os machos se movem quando não obtêm cópulas, e ficam onde estão
após uma cópula. Se os machos se movem em busca de cópulas, esperamos que eles
prefiram ir para a planta mais próxima com maior número de fêmeas. Usamos modelos
mistos para investigar a movimentação dos machos em uma população natural no México.
Observamos que os machos se movem mais quando encontram poucas fêmeas na planta
em que estão e quando copulam pouco. Adicionalmente, usamos um modelo de
montagem de redes para testar para onde os machos se movem. Observamos que
machos têm maior probabilidade de ir para plantas próximas e com alto número de
fêmeas. Concluímos que machos se movem estrategicamente, saindo de plantas onde há
poucas oportunidades de cópula e indo para plantas adjacentes onde a disponibilidade de
fêmeas é maior. Essa estratégia deve minimizar os custos de busca por parceiras e
maximizar o sucesso de acasalamento dos machos.”
abstract_english:
In scramble competition type mating systems, disputes between males are rare or absent and
absent or rare, and the theoretical expectation is that highly mobile males obtain more copulations.
more copulations. Leptinotarsa undecimlineata is a species with a scramble competition
scramble competition, in which individuals copulate only on the host plant.
In this species, movement and reproductive success are related in a peculiar way: the
males that move the most, are the ones that copulate the least. One hypothesis that could explain this
this pattern is that males move when they do not copulate, and stay where they are after copulation.
after copulation. If males move around in search of copulations, we expect that they
prefer to go to the nearest plant with the greatest number of females. We use mixed
models to investigate the movement of males in a natural population in Mexico.
We observed that males move more when they find few females on the plant
plant they are on and when they copulate infrequently. In addition, we use a network assembly model to test
model to test where the males move to. We observed that
males are more likely to go to nearby plants with high numbers of females.
females. We conclude that males move strategically, leaving plants where there are
opportunities for mating and move to adjacent plants where females are more available.
females. This strategy should minimize mate search costs and
maximize the males' mating success."

title_original: A mais longa história que conhecemos: 750 milhões de anos de evolução de tecamebas
title_english: The longest history we know: 750 million years of the evolution of tecamebas
abstract_original:
Testate amoebae are abundant organisms inhabiting freshwater and terrestrial
systems. Because they have a shell (test), they have been used as convenient tools in a
number of areas: ecology, paleoecology, paleoenvironmental reconstruction, etc. Also, the
shell makes these organisms the only ones with fossiliferous potential, and indeed represent
the earliest unambiguous fossils of eukaryotes with over 750 million year
speciments. Recent years have seen an increase of available data for the analyses and
interpretation of evolutionary events in the history of testate amoebae. In this talk, I will
focus on how the several types of new evidence have influenced our understanding of the
testate amoebae in the Arcellinida clade. There are three distinct parts to this talk: 1) novel
molecular data and recent phylogenetic reconstructions, what are the currently recognized
groups within Arcellinida and what has been demystified; 2) fossil evidence, its
interpretation and its integration to the current phylogenetic framework; 3) diversification
in arcellinid testate amoebae, cryptic/pseudocryptic species and the consequences to
evolutionary interpretations. I will conclude trying to delineate the new avenues of research
that have been opened and which main issues remain unanswered. Slides for this talk will
be in English, but the talk will be in Portuguese unless requested otherwise.
abstract_english:
Testate amoebae are abundant organisms inhabiting freshwater and terrestrial
systems. Because they have a shell (test), they have been used as convenient tools in a
number of areas: ecology, paleoecology, paleoenvironmental reconstruction, etc. Also, the
shell makes these organisms the only ones with fossiliferous potential, and indeed represent

that have been opened and which main issues remain unanswered. Slides for this talk will
be in English, but the talk will be in Portuguese unless requested otherwise.

title_original: Understanding the function and evolution of worm nervous systems by two case studies: (1)regeneration in polyclad marine flatworms and (2) behavioral genetics of terrestrial roundworms
title_english: Understanding the function and evolution of worm nervous systems by two case studies: (1)regeneration in polyclad marine flatworms and (2) behavioral genetics of terrestrial roundworms
abstract_original:
In this talk, I will discuss concepts related to mechanisms of evolutionary
change, specifically: co-option, subfunctionalization, cryptic
genotypic/phenotypic variation, modularity, and developmental systems
drift. I will provide experimental evidence on the occurrence of, at least,
some of these in three experimental invertebrate models studied in my

laboratory. Co-option and subfunctionalization will be shown in the four-
eyed whirligig beetle that shows differences in opsin expression of dorsal

and ventral eyes; a novel and cryptic brain will be shown to develop after
decapitation of polyclad flatworms; and different neurotransmitters will
shown to modulate the same stand-and-wave behavior (i.e. nictation) in
different species of nematodes.”
abstract_english:
In this talk, I will discuss concepts related to mechanisms of evolutionary
change, specifically: co-option, subfunctionalization, cryptic
genotypic/phenotypic variation, modularity, and developmental systems
drift. I will provide experimental evidence on the occurrence of, at least,
some of these in three experimental invertebrate models studied in my

laboratory. Co-option and subfunctionalization will be shown in the four-
eyed whirligig beetle that shows differences in opsin expression of dorsal

and ventral eyes; a novel and cryptic brain will be shown to develop after
decapitation of polyclad flatworms; and different neurotransmitters will
shown to modulate the same stand-and-wave behavior (i.e. nictation) in
different species of nematodes.”

title_original: An Overview of Lignin Metabolism and Its Effect on Biomass Recalcitrance
title_english: An Overview of Lignin Metabolism and Its Effect on Biomass Recalcitrance
abstract_original: Lignin, after cellulose, is the second most abundant biopolymer on Earth, accounting for 30% of the organic carbon in the biosphere. It is considered an important evolutionary adaptation of plants during their transition from the aquatic environment to land, since it bestowed the early tracheophytes with physical support to stand upright and enabled long-distance transport of water and solutes by waterproofing the vascular tissue. Although essential for plant growth and development, lignin is the major plant cell wall component responsible for biomass recalcitrance to industrial processing. The fact that lignin is a non-linear aromatic polymer built with chemically diverse and poorly reactive linkages and a variety of monomer units precludes the ability of any single enzyme to properly recognize and degrade it. Consequently, the use of lignocellulosic feedstock as a renewable and sustainable resource for the production of biofuels and bio-based materials will depend on the identification and characterization of the factors that determine plant biomass recalcitrance, especially the highly complex phenolic polymer lignin. Here, I summarize the current knowledge regarding lignin metabolism in plants, its effect on biomass recalcitrance and the emergent strategies to modify biomass recalcitrance through metabolic engineering of the lignin pathway.
abstract_english: Lignin, after cellulose, is the second most abundant biopolymer on Earth, accounting for 30% of the organic carbon in the biosphere. It is considered an important evolutionary adaptation of plants during their transition from the aquatic environment to land, since it bestowed the early tracheophytes with physical support to stand upright and enabled long-distance transport of water and solutes by waterproofing the vascular tissue. Although essential for plant growth and development, lignin is the major plant cell wall component responsible for biomass recalcitrance to industrial processing. The fact that lignin is a non-linear aromatic polymer built with chemically diverse and poorly reactive linkages and a variety of monomer units precludes the ability of any single enzyme to properly recognize and degrade it. Consequently, the use of lignocellulosic feedstock as a renewable and sustainable resource for the production of biofuels and bio-based materials will depend on the identification and characterization of the factors that determine plant biomass recalcitrance, especially the highly complex phenolic polymer lignin. Here, I summarize the current knowledge regarding lignin metabolism in plants, its effect on biomass recalcitrance and the emergent strategies to modify biomass recalcitrance through metabolic engineering of the lignin pathway.

title_original: Evidência de plasticidade em aranhas minúsculas: construção de orbiteias por ninfas de Leucage argyra em espaços reduzidos
title_english: Evidence for plasticity in tiny spiders: orbital construction by Leucage argyra nymphs in confined spaces
abstract_original:
A hipótese de limitação em comportamento por tamanho prevê que animais pequenos,
por causa das implicações de manter um cérebro proporcionalmente grande e caro, terão
capacidades comportamentais limitadas. Testei esta hipótese comparando se as ninfas
de Leucauge argyra(Walckenaer 1842) foram capazes de realizar os mesmos ajustes
comportamentais extremos em suas teias orbitais para adaptá-las a espaços restritos,
reportados nas adultas da mesma espécie. Encontrei três tipos de evidência contra a
hipótese de limitação em comportamento por tamanho: (1) as ninfas foram capazes de
realizar todos os ajustes comportamentais realizados pelas adultas em suas teias orbitais
em espaços reduzidos; (2) as ninfas não mostraram menor precisão comportamental em
os ajustes aos espaços restritos do que as adultas e (3) as ninfas menores foram capazes
de fazer os mesmos ajustes comportamentais que as maiores. Os ajustes complexos
observados usando tamanhos extremos de aranhas que constroem teias orbitais, permitiu
fornecer a prova mais sensível da hipótese da limitação em comportamento por tamanho
até agora realizada.
abstract_english:
The hypothesis of limitation in behavior by size predicts that small animals,
because of the implications of maintaining a proportionally large and expensive brain, will have
limited behavioral capabilities. I tested this hypothesis by comparing whether nymphs
of Leucauge argyra(Walckenaer 1842) were able to make the same extreme behavioral
extreme behavioral adjustments in their orbital webs to adapt them to restricted spaces,
reported in adults of the same species. I found three types of evidence against the
size limitation hypothesis: (1) the nymphs were able to make all the behavioral
(1) nymphs were able to perform all the behavioral adjustments made by adults on their orbital webs in
(2) nymphs showed no less behavioral precision in adjustments to
the adjustments to the restricted spaces than the adults; and (3) the smaller nymphs were able
to make the same behavioral adjustments as the larger nymphs. The complex adjustments
observed using extreme sizes of spiders that build orbital webs, allowed
provide the most sensitive evidence for the hypothesis of limitation in behavior by size
so far performed.

title_original: Coevolução em redes de interação antagonistas
title_english: Coevolution in antagonistic interaction networks
abstract_original:
Redes de interações entre espécies antagonistas, tais como entre predadores e presas,
apresentam uma grande diversidade de padrões estruturais com potenciais implicações para a
evolução e coevolução das espécies. Neste trabalho nós modelamos a evolução de um
fenótipo que determina o sucesso de ataque e defesa para explorar o papel das interações
multi-específicas sobre a coevolução das espécies. Os resultados indicam que a evolução
fenotípica é determinada pela intensidade da seleção imposta pelas espécies e que a
existência de assimetrias entre exploradores e vítimas na intensidade da seleção influencia a
dinâmica coevolutiva. Alto aninhamento das redes favoreceu flutuações, enquanto que alta
modularidade promoveu mudança direcional dos fenótipos. Espécies muito conectadas
apresentaram maior variação temporal dos seus diferenciais de seleção, o que resultou em um
menor acoplamento fenotípico com seus parceiros de interação e favoreceu a especialização,
o que aumentou a modularidade e reduziu o aninhamento das redes. Nossos resultados
sugerem que estruturas modulares tem um efeito estabilizador na dinâmica coevolutiva das
espécies em redes antagonistas e que o grau do acoplamento fenotípico entre as espécies deve
ser correlacionado com seus padrões de interação ”.
abstract_english:
Networks of interactions between antagonistic species, such as between predators and prey,
exhibit a great diversity of structural patterns with potential implications for the
evolution and coevolution of species. In this work we model the evolution of a
phenotype that determines attack and defense success to explore the role of multispecies interactions
multi-species interactions on species coevolution. The results indicate that phenotypic
is determined by the intensity of selection imposed by the species, and that the existence of
asymmetries between exploiters and victims in the intensity of selection influences the
coevolutionary dynamics. High nestedness of the networks favored fluctuations, while high
modularity promoted directional change of phenotypes. Highly connected species
species showed more temporal variation in their selection differentials, which resulted in less phenotypic
phenotypic coupling with their interaction partners and favored specialization,
which increased modularity and reduced network nesting. Our results
suggest that modular structures have a stabilizing effect on the coevolutionary dynamics of
species in antagonistic networks and that the degree of phenotypic coupling between species
be correlated with their interaction patterns ."

title_original: Economia Ecológica
title_english: Ecological Economics
abstract_original:
Poucos são os temas da sociedade contemporânea hoje capazes de ensejar consenso.
Entretanto, apesar das enormes diferenças econômicas, políticas e culturais existentes na
sociedade, todos concordam num ponto: precisamos trabalhar pelo desenvolvimento sustentável’.
Há a percepção generalizada de que tem havido uma piora nas condições ambientais, corroborada
tanto pela variedade dos problemas quanto pela escala deles (a lista é extensa: aquecimento
global, destruição da camada de ozônio, desmatamento, extinção de espécies, diminuição dos
recursos hídricos, lixo, etc.). Embora seja difícil distinguir entre catastrofismo e preocupação
fundamentada nas notícias que vemos na mídia, a intuição de que há algo errado tem se difundido
e ganhado apoio. Por conseguinte, movimentos políticos de matizes ideológicas as mais diversas
têm professado seu compromisso com o desenvolvimento sustentável’. Mas o que isso quer dizer
mesmo?
Em que pese a aceitação política do ideário da sustentabilidade ambiental, as soluções
concretas para os problemas levantados pela agenda da sustentabilidade têm sido tímidas.
Décadas depois do Relatório Brundtland e da Rio-92, os países sequer têm consenso quanto às
metas a serem atingidas, e ainda menos quanto aos meios para cumpri-las. Por que isso? Trata-se
apenas de mais um caso clássico de cegueira e má vontade dos políticos?
abstract_english:
Few topics in contemporary society today are capable of commanding consensus.
However, despite the enormous economic, political and cultural differences that exist in society, everyone
society, everyone agrees on one point: we need to work toward sustainable development.
There is a widespread perception that environmental conditions have worsened, borne out by both the variety of problems and the scale of the problem.
by both the variety of problems and their scale (the list is long: global warming
depletion of the ozone layer, deforestation, species extinction, dwindling water resources, waste, etc.
water resources, waste, etc.). Although it is difficult to distinguish between catastrophism and concern
concern based on the news we see in the media, the intuition that something is wrong has been spreading
and gaining support. As a result, political movements of the most diverse ideological hues have professed their commitment to development.
have professed their commitment to sustainable development. But what does this really mean?
really mean?
Despite the political acceptance of the ideology of environmental sustainability, concrete solutions for the problems
concrete solutions to the problems raised by the sustainability agenda have been timid.
Decades after the Brundtland Report and Rio-92, countries do not even have a consensus on the
goals to be reached, let alone the means to achieve them. Why is this? This is
just another classic case of politicians' blindness and ill will?

title_original: Resource-based modeling in evolutionary game theory
title_english: Resource-based modeling in evolutionary game theory
abstract_original:
The evolution of cooperation is one of the most intriguing conundrum in evolutionary
biology. Natural selection favours traits that increase individual’s ability to reproduce or
survive. One individual is said to be cooperative if it provides a benefit to another individual
or to a group at the expense of its own relative fitness. According to evolutionary theory
such cooperative behaviour is detrimental to the individual and should be counter-selected.
Instead, the selfish behaviour is expected to arise and invade in a group of cooperators.
However, cooperation is observed everywhere. Despite the great attention the issue has
received in the last decades our understanding about the underlying mechanisms that
explain the emergence and maintenance of cooperation is still poor. Here we combine the
frameworks of resource-based modeling and evolutionary game theory to study the
conditions under which cooperative strains can thrive. In the talk we will present our recent
studies for the evolution of cooperation within the context of multilevel selection, where
individuals (cells) are organised into groups. Selection occurs at both individual and group
levels. Selection in the group level stems from differentiated growth rates that vary
according to the groups composition. This approach can be related to the problem of the
emergence of multicellular form of life.
abstract_english:
The evolution of cooperation is one of the most intriguing conundrum in evolutionary
biology. Natural selection favours traits that increase individual’s ability to reproduce or
survive. One individual is said to be cooperative if it provides a benefit to another individual
or to a group at the expense of its own relative fitness. According to evolutionary theory
such cooperative behaviour is detrimental to the individual and should be counter-selected.
Instead, the selfish behaviour is expected to arise and invade in a group of cooperators.
However, cooperation is observed everywhere. Despite the great attention the issue has

levels. Selection in the group level stems from differentiated growth rates that vary
according to the groups composition. This approach can be related to the problem of the
emergence of multicellular form of life.

title_original: Por que as espécies de aves endêmicas da Mata Atlântica não são mais encontradas no interior de São Paulo
title_english: Why endemic Atlantic Forest bird species are no longer found in the interior of São Paulo
abstract_original:
O Estado de São Paulo possui uma peculiar distribuição de seus domínios fitogeográficos: o
Cerrado o corta de norte a sul, separando a Mata Atlântica em duas porções. Embora sua
descaracterização seja acentuada na porção leste, sua condição ao oeste do Cerrado é mais
preocupante, pois há poucas unidades de conservação e apenas um bloco florestal contínuo, o
Parque Estadual do Morro do Diabo. A avifauna do interior do Estado pôde ser razoavelmente
caracterizada até a década de 1980. Estes dados revelam a pretérita presença de diversas
espécies endêmicas da Mata Atlântica nas matas estacionais do noroeste paulista. Censos
recentes (entre 1990 e 2015) realizados nesta região foram incapazes de registrar tais espécies.
Similarmente, o banco de dados do Wiki Aves (um site que gera mapas de distribuição de
espécies de aves em território nacional a partir de localidades onde usuários fizeram registros
fotográficos ou sonoros) não indica a presença dessas espécies. No entanto, há centenas de
registros de aves florestais em toda a extensão da área referida. Estas observações tornam-se
mais intrigantes ao se analisar a atual distribuição das espécies de aves endêmicas da Mata
Atlântica do Paraná. Não apenas o bioma do nordeste deste Estado é considerado o mesmo do
noroeste de São Paulo (matas estacionais), como os históricos de ocupação humana e de
fragmentação são similares. No entanto, todas as espécies endêmicas da Mata Atlântica ainda
são encontradas no nordeste paranaense. Este projeto pretende determinar se a ausência atual
das espécies de aves endêmicas da Mata Atlântica simplesmente reflete os poucos inventários
recentes conduzidos no noroeste de São Paulo ou se ela resulta de extinção regional.”
abstract_english:
The state of São Paulo has a peculiar distribution of its phytogeographic domains: the
Cerrado cuts it from north to south, separating the Atlantic Forest in two portions. Although its
its uncharacterization is accentuated in the eastern portion, its condition west of the Cerrado is more
there are few protected areas and only one continuous forest block, the Morro do Diabo State Park
Morro do Diabo State Park. The avifauna of the interior of the state could be reasonably characterized
characterized until the 1980s. These data reveal the former presence of several endemic
endemic species of the Atlantic Forest in the seasonal forests of northwestern São Paulo. Censuses
recent (between 1990 and 2015) conducted in this region were unable to record such species.
Similarly, the Wiki Aves database (a website that generates distribution maps of bird species
species in the national territory from locations where users have made photographic or audio records)
photographic or audio records) does not indicate the presence of these species. However, there are hundreds of
records of forest birds throughout the extent of the area referred to. These observations become more intriguing
more intriguing when one analyzes the current distribution of bird species endemic to the Atlantic Forest of Paraná.
Atlantic Forest of Paraná. Not only is the northeastern biome of this state considered the same as the
São Paulo (seasonal rainforest), as the history of human occupation and fragmentation is similar.
human occupation and fragmentation are similar. However, all Atlantic Forest endemic species are still found in northeastern Paraná.
are still found in northeastern Paraná. This project aims to determine whether the current absence
of Atlantic Forest endemic bird species simply reflects the few recent inventories conducted in northwestern
conducted in northwestern São Paulo or if it is a result of regional extinction."

title_original: Termorregulação e desempenho fisiológico de Thoropa taophora (Cycloranphidae)
title_english: Thermoregulation and physiological performance of Thoropa taophora (Cycloranphidae)
abstract_original:
As funções biológicas dos animais ectotérmicos são fortemente influenciadas pela
temperatura ambiental. Nos ambientes com ampla variação térmica, a regulação da
temperatura corpórea e a modificação dos desempenhos fisiológicos são as principais
respostas exibidas pelos ectotérmicos para compensar os efeitos negativos da alta
temperatura. Em girinos, os efeitos da temperatura sobre o comportamento e a fisiologia
são ainda mais intensos devido à alta condutância térmica causada pela baixa relação
entre a superfície e o volume corpóreo. Nessa palestra, abordarei como o conhecimento
da fisiologia e do comportamento estão relacionados à ecologia térmica dos girinos. Para
isso, dividi a palestra em dois tópicos principais: 1) Contextualização teórica sobre os
efeitos da temperatura no comportamento e na fisiologia de animais ectotérmicos; 2) Um
estudo de caso sobre a variação do comportamento termorregulatório e do desempenho
locomotor de girinos Thoropa taophora entre populações que habitam locais com
diferentes temperaturas ambientais.”
abstract_english:
The biological functions of ectothermic animals are strongly influenced by the
environmental temperature. In environments with wide thermal variation, the regulation of
temperature regulation and the modification of physiological performance are the main
responses exhibited by ectotherms to compensate for the negative effects of high
temperature. In tadpoles the effects of temperature on behavior and physiology are even more intense
behavior and physiology are even more intense due to the high thermal conductance caused by the low surface area
between body surface area and body volume. In this lecture, I will discuss how knowledge
physiology and behavior are related to the thermal ecology of tadpoles. To
I have divided the lecture into two main topics: 1) Theoretical background on the effects of temperature
effects of temperature on the behavior and physiology of ectothermic animals; 2) A case
study on the variation of thermoregulatory behavior and locomotor performance of
locomotor performance of Thoropa taophora tadpoles among populations inhabiting sites with
different environmental temperatures."

title_original: A radiação evolutiva de carnívora após migrações entre continentes
title_english: The evolutionary radiation of carnivora after migrations between continents
abstract_original:
Os padrões de diversidade foram amplamente influenciados por migrações de espécies entre
continentes. Entretanto, o nosso conhecimento sobre as consequências macroevolutivas de
migrações é limitado. Estudamos oito famílias de mamíferos da ordem Carnivora que migraram
entre Eurásia e América do Norte durante o Cenozoico para compreender as consequências desses
intercâmbios faunísticos para a dinâmica macroevolutiva. Estimamos as taxas de especiação e
extinção das diferentes linhagens a partir de ocorrências fósseis usando uma abordagem Bayesiana
que leva em conta a imperfeição do registro. Essas análises mostram um padrão altamente
assimétrico caracterizado por radiações evolutivas nas linhagens que invadiram a Eurásia, ao passo
que linhagens que invadiram a América do Norte mantiveram uma dinâmica de diversificação mais
uniforme. A radiação das linhagens que invadiram a Eurásia coincide com o declínio de linhagens
de carnívoros já estabelecidas no continente e com episódios de mudanças climáticas. Essa
congruência temporal sugere que diferenças na disponibilidade de oportunidades ecológicas”
podem ter sido responsáveis pela disparidade na dinâmica de diversificação entre continentes.
Nossos resultados revelam efeitos de longo prazo de invasões biológicas e mostram a importância
de radiações evolutivas em moldar padrões de diversidade na escala de continentes.
abstract_english:
"Diversity patterns have been largely influenced by species migrations between
continents. However, our knowledge about the macroevolutionary consequences of
migrations is limited. We studied eight families of mammals of the order Carnivora that migrated
between Eurasia and North America during the Cenozoic to understand the consequences of these
faunal exchanges for macroevolutionary dynamics. We estimate the speciation and
extinction rates of the different lineages from fossil occurrences using a Bayesian approach
approach that takes into account the imperfection of the record. These analyses show a highly
asymmetric pattern characterized by evolutionary radiations in the lineages that invaded Eurasia, while
while lineages that invaded North America maintained a more uniform diversification dynamic.
uniform. The radiation of the lineages that invaded Eurasia coincides with the decline of lineages
of carnivore lineages already established on the continent and with episodes of climate change. This
temporal congruence suggests that differences in the availability of ecological opportunities" may have
may have been responsible for the disparity in diversification dynamics between continents.
Our results reveal long-term effects of biological invasions and show the importance
of evolutionary radiations in shaping patterns of diversity at the scale of continents."

title_original: Cuida bem porque é pãe ou é pãe porque cuida bem? Coevolução entre esforço paternal e características que enviesam a paternidade
title_english: Do you care well because you are a parent or are you a parent because you care well? Coevolution between parenting effort and characteristics that bias parenting
abstract_original:
Uma questão central em ecologia comportamental é como o custoso cuidado parental dos machos
pode ter evoluído e se mantido por seleção natural, apesar da promiscuidade das fêmeas e
consequente diminuição de paternidade adquirida na prole cuidada. Avanços teóricos baseados em
hipóteses amplamente aceitas sobre investimento parental, história de vida e seleção sexual predizem
que o esforço paternal deveria responder a variações no nível de promiscuidade das fêmeas, tanto
comportamentalmente quanto evolutivamente. Isso porque machos incapazes de ajustar seu esforço
parental em resposta à paternidade esperada deveriam ter sido penalizados ao longo do tempo
evolutivo, uma vez que desperdiçariam tempo e energia ao investir in indivíduos não relacionados
geneticamente. Resultados empíricos, entretanto, não apontam para um padrão generalizado de
ajustes comportamentais a pistas que denotem mudanças na promiscuidade das fêmeas. Além disso,
grande variação na paternidade tem sido observada entre espécies nas quais os machos cuidam da
prole. Levando em conta a grande variação natural dos custos do cuidado entre espécies, eu estou
propondo desenvolver uma nova teoria que reverta essa relação evolutiva, de modo que o esforço
paternal teria, na verdade, desempenhado um papel mais decisivo, modulando o nível de paternidade
adquirida pelos machos, em um processo mediado por seleção sexual. Neste sentido, vou inicialmente
formalizar matematicamente minha hipótese e gerar previsões claras que a diferenciem da visão
tradicional. Além disso, vou conduzir análises comparativas em diversos grupos taxonômicos para
testar a validade e generalidade das diferentes histórias evolutivas pressupostas por cada hipótese.
Assim, construirei um novo corpo teórico para investigar a co-evolução entre esforço paternal e
características que enviesam a paternidade que reverte conceitualmente a relação de causa e efeito de
variáveis que são amplamente utilizadas na área de ecologia comportamental.”
abstract_english:
A central question in behavioral ecology is how the costly parental care of males
may have evolved and been maintained by natural selection, despite the promiscuity of females and
consequent decrease in acquired paternity in the cared-for offspring. Theoretical advances based on
widely accepted hypotheses about parental investment, life history, and sexual selection predict
that paternal effort should respond to variations in the level of promiscuity of females, both
behaviorally and evolutionarily. This is because males unable to adjust their parental
parental effort in response to expected paternity should have been penalized over evolutionary time, since they
time, since they would have wasted time and energy by investing in genetically unrelated individuals.
genetically related individuals. Empirical results, however, do not point to a generalized pattern of
behavioral adjustments to cues denoting changes in female promiscuity. Furthermore,
large variation in paternity has been observed among species in which males care for their offspring.
offspring. Taking into account the large natural variation in care costs between species, I am
proposing to develop a new theory that reverses this evolutionary relationship, so that paternal effort would have actually
paternal effort would actually have played a more decisive role, modulating the level of paternity
acquired by males, in a process mediated by sexual selection. In this sense, I will initially
mathematically formalize my hypothesis and generate clear predictions that differentiate it from the traditional view.
traditional view. In addition, I will conduct comparative analyses in different taxonomic groups to
test the validity and generality of the different evolutionary histories assumed by each hypothesis.
Thus, I will build a new body of theory to investigate the co-evolution between paternal effort and
characteristics that bias paternity that conceptually reverses the cause-and-effect relationship of
variables that are widely used in the field of behavioral ecology."

title_original: A evolução do mapa genotipo-fenotipo e suas consequências para a co-variação
title_english: The evolution of the genotype-phenotype map and its consequences for covariance
abstract_original:
Evolução só pode acontecer na presença de variação, e, especialmente para
sistemas complexos, o padrão de variação compartilhado entre os diversos
caracteres é fundamental para compreender o processo evolutivo. Associações
genéticas entre caracteres podem facilitar ou enviesar a resposta evolutiva, e sem
uma teoria robusta sobre a covariação não podemos entender a diversidade de
morfologias na natureza. Dentro desse contexto, podemos nos perguntar como os
padrões de associação genética evoluem, e como isso impacta o potencial evolutivo
das populações que respondem à seleção. Procuramos abordar essas perguntas
utilizando técnicas computacionais e experimentais, e mostramos que seleção
direcional tem um papel fundamental em moldar a estrutura genética e os padrões de
variação na natureza, agindo de forma frequentemente não intuitiva. Além disso,
mostramos que para entender de forma profunda o processo evolutivo é fundamental
considerarmos o aspecto multivariado de sistemas naturais.”
abstract_english:
Evolution can only happen in the presence of variation, and, especially for
complex systems, the pattern of variation shared among diverse
characters is fundamental to understanding the evolutionary process. Associations
genetic associations between characters can either facilitate or bias the evolutionary response, and without
robust theory of covariation we cannot understand the diversity of morphologies in nature.
morphologies in nature. Within this context, we may wonder how patterns of genetic
patterns of genetic association evolve, and how this impacts the evolutionary potential of
of populations that respond to selection. We seek to address these questions
using computational and experimental techniques, and show that directional
selection plays a key role in shaping genetic structure and patterns of variation in
variation in nature, acting in ways that are often non-intuitive. Furthermore,
In addition, we show that to deeply understand the evolutionary process it is fundamental
to consider the multivariate aspect of natural systems."

title_original: Global amphibian declines and a fungal pathogen
title_english: Global amphibian declines and a fungal pathogen
abstract_original:
Global amphibian declines began in Australia with the mysterious disappearance of the
Southern Day Frog (Taudactylus diurnus) in 1979. Twenty years later the chytrid fungus
(Batrachochytrium dendrobatidis) was described and documented as a pathogenic fungus.
This pandemic pathogen has now been recorded throughout most regions of the world and
has been directly linked to devastating declines and extinctions in many amphibians.
Herein I examine the history of global amphibian declines and the role of this novel
pathogen in explaining these declines. The known knowns (what have we learned in the
last 15 years), the known unknowns (what we still don’t know), the unknown unknowns
(what we can do to prevent future wildlife disease epidemics). Current research is
focussing on the continuing and chronic impacts of chytrid as it is now endemic in many
populations, and solutions for controlling the disease in captivity and in the wild. Managers
can use this research to prevent the introduction of novel pathogens and mitigate wildlife
epidemics in the future.”
abstract_english:
Global amphibian declines began in Australia with the mysterious disappearance of the
Southern Day Frog (Taudactylus diurnus) in 1979. Twenty years later the chytrid fungus
(Batrachochytrium dendrobatidis) was described and documented as a pathogenic fungus.
This pandemic pathogen has now been recorded throughout most regions of the world and
has been directly linked to devastating declines and extinctions in many amphibians.
Herein I examine the history of global amphibian declines and the role of this novel
pathogen in explaining these declines. The known knowns (what have we learned in the
last 15 years), the known unknowns (what we still don’t know), the unknown unknowns
(what we can do to prevent future wildlife disease epidemics). Current research is
focussing on the continuing and chronic impacts of chytrid as it is now endemic in many
populations, and solutions for controlling the disease in captivity and in the wild. Managers
can use this research to prevent the introduction of novel pathogens and mitigate wildlife
epidemics in the future.”

title_original: O papel da ecologia na ecotoxicologia
title_english: The role of ecology in ecotoxicology
abstract_original:
Muitas pessoas, mesmo no mundo acadêmico, associam o estudo dos efeitos de substâncias tóxicas nos
organismos a estudos laboratoriais em organismos padronizados. A ecotoxicologia vai além disso: como
seu nome indica, tem o intuito de fornecer informações sobre os efeitos dos tóxicos nos ecossistemas e
comunidades. É por isso que a ecotoxicologia utiliza estudos com desenhos experimentais mais complexos,
utilizando mesocosmos ou estudos de campo para aproximar o máximo possível os resultados e
observações aos efeitos das substâncias tóxicas no meio natural. Nesta palestra, vou apresentar como a
ecotoxicologia, em especial a ecotoxicologia aquática, está baseada em conceitos da ecologia para explicar
e predizer os efeitos dessas substâncias nas comunidades e ecossistemas. Para isso, vou apresentar
exemplos de alguns trabalhos nos quais foram utilizadas diferentes abordagens experimentais para o
estudo dos efeitos das substâncias tóxicas nos ecossistemas. Primeiramente, vou apresentar um trabalho
que mostra como diferentes pesticidas alteram a estrutura de um ecossistema. Depois, outro trabalho que
explica como um pesticida pode alterar os parâmetros funcionais do ecossistema. Finalmente, vou expor
dois trabalhos que alertam sobre possíveis efeitos de poluentes emergentes na estrutura da comunidade
em um rio mediterrâneo. Esses trabalhos, e muitos outros, foram desenhados com o intuito de estudar os
efeitos de substâncias tóxicas em comunidades e ecossistemas e, assim, podem fornecer subsídios ao
gerenciamento e controle dos riscos advindos da presença dessas substâncias no meio aquático”.
abstract_english:
Many people, even in the academic world, associate the study of the effects of toxic substances on
organisms to laboratory studies in standardized organisms. Ecotoxicology goes beyond this: as
its name implies, it aims to provide information about the effects of toxicants on ecosystems and
communities. This is why ecotoxicology uses studies with more complex experimental designs,
using mesocosms or field studies to bring the results and observations as close as possible to the
observations as closely as possible to the effects of toxic substances in the natural environment. In this lecture, I will present how
ecotoxicology, in particular aquatic ecotoxicology, is based on concepts from ecology to explain and
and predict the effects of these substances on communities and ecosystems. To do this, I will present
examples of some work in which different experimental approaches were used to study the effects
study the effects of toxic substances in ecosystems. First, I will present a paper
that shows how different pesticides alter the structure of an ecosystem. Then, another paper that
explains how a pesticide can alter the functional parameters of the ecosystem. Finally, I will present
two papers that warn about possible effects of emerging pollutants on community structure in a
structure in a Mediterranean river. These papers, and many others, were designed to study the
effects of toxic substances on communities and ecosystems, and thus can provide subsidies for the management and
management and control of the risks arising from the presence of these substances in the aquatic environment."

title_original: Dinâmica de diversificação de placentária (Mammalia): Integrando o registro fóssil com filogenias moleculares
title_english: Dynamics of placental diversification (Mammalia): Integrating the fossil record with molecular phylogenies
abstract_original:
O efeito de caracteres intrínsecos na dinâmica de diversificação foram extensamente
investigados e diversos caracteres foram associados com aumentos na diversificação.
Contudo, os possíveis efeitos negativos de um caractere sobre a diversificação de uma
linhagem foram em grande parte ignorados. No presente trabalho integramos o registro
fóssil com dados moleculares para estudar a dinâmica de diversificação de Placentalia,
focando nas ordens em declínio de diversidade, e investigamos possíveis mecanismos
responsáveis por gerar os padrões de diversificação encontrados. Mais especificamente
nós: 1- determinamos quais das 21 ordens de Placentalia estão em declínio de diversidade
(i.e., declínio); 2- investigamos se o declínio apresenta um sinal filogenético; 3- testamos a
hipótese de que o tamanho do corpo está relacionado com o declínio; 4- testamos a
hipótese de que as ordens em declínio possuem menor disparidade morfológica; 5-
investigamos se as ordens em declínio, inferido a partir do registro fóssil, são as mesmas
com maior risco de extinção na atualidade.
abstract_english:
The effect of intrinsic characters on diversification dynamics have been extensively
investigated and several characters have been associated with increases in diversification.
However, the possible negative effects of a character on the diversification of a
lineage have been largely ignored. In the present work we integrate the fossil
In the present work we integrate the fossil record with molecular data to study the diversification dynamics of Placentalia,
and investigated possible mechanisms responsible for generating the patterns of diversification in Placentalia
responsible for generating the patterns of diversification found. More specifically
we: 1- determined which of the 21 orders of Placentalia are in diversity decline
(i.e., decline); 2- investigate whether the decline presents a phylogenetic signal; 3- test the hypothesis that body size is in
hypothesis that body size is related to decline; 4- test the hypothesis that declining orders
4- test the hypothesis that declining orders have less morphological disparity
investigate whether the orders in decline, inferred from the fossil record, are the same as those
at greatest risk of extinction today.

title_original: Pequenas áreas protegidas são refugio para peixes e corais nas ilhas Fiji
title_english: Small protected areas provide refuge for fish and coral in Fiji
abstract_original:
Em recifes de corais, o estabelecimento de áreas marinhas protegidas (AMPs) é uma estratégia amplamente usada
para preservar ecossistemas saudáveis e recuperar recifes degradados. Porém, pouco se sabe se benefícios
proporcionados por essa estratégia também são fornecidos por reservas pequenas (< 1 km2

), que podem ser menores do
que a área de vida de muitas espécies de peixes. Também, poucos estudos examinaram o feito de AMPs em diferentes
níveis de organização de recifes de corais; de interações sociais à estrutura de assembleias e processos ecossistêmicos.
Comparamos a cobertura bentônica, estrutura de assembleias de peixes, composição de cardumes e densidade de corais
jovens entre três pares de áreas protegidas e não-protegidas em recifes de corais em Fiji, no Pacífico Sul. Essas AMPs
são manejadas por comunidades locais e foram estabelecidas entre 8 e 10 anos antes do estudo. AMPs tiveram maior
cobertura de corais, menor quantidade de macroalgas e maior densidade e biomassa de algumas categorias tróficas de
peixes, incluindo herbívoros e piscívoros, que áreas não protegidas. Cardumes apresentaram maior diversidade de
espécies dentro de AMPs, mas número de indivíduos semelhante entre áreas protegidas e não protegidas, apenas de
cardumes com mais de 75 indivíduos terem ocorrido exclusivamente em AMPs. Duas áreas protegidas tiveram três
vezes mais corais jovens que áreas não protegidas vizinhas. Apesar da maior parte dos estudos sobre benefícios de
AMPs em recifes de corais terem sido feitos em grandes áreas protegidas (> 5 km2

), nossos resultados indicam que
pequenas AMPs também beneficiam comunidades de peixes recifais, com consequências positivas para a cobertura
bentônica, interações sociais de peixes e processos ecológicos”.
abstract_english:
On coral reefs, the establishment of marine protected areas (MPAs) is a widely used strategy
to preserve healthy ecosystems and restore degraded reefs. However, little is known about whether benefits
provided by this strategy are also provided by small reserves (< 1 km2

), which may be smaller than the
than the home range of many fish species. Also, few studies have examined the effect of MPAs at different
levels of coral reef organization; from social interactions to assemblage structure and ecosystem processes.
We compared benthic cover, fish assemblage structure, school composition, and coral density
juveniles between three pairs of protected and unprotected areas on coral reefs in Fiji, South Pacific. These MPAs
are managed by local communities and were established between 8 and 10 years prior to the study. MPAs had higher coral
coral cover, less macroalgae, and higher density and biomass of some trophic categories of fish, including herbivores and
including herbivores and piscivores, than unprotected areas. Shoals showed higher species diversity within MPAs, but
species diversity within MPAs, but similar numbers of individuals between protected and unprotected areas, with only
shoals with more than 75 individuals occurred exclusively in MPAs. Two protected areas had three
times more young corals than neighboring unprotected areas. Although most studies on the benefits of
MPAs on coral reefs have been done in large protected areas (> 5 km2

), our results indicate that
small MPAs also benefit reef fish communities, with positive consequences for benthic cover
benthic cover, fish social interactions, and ecological processes."
